comments.body: we are removing these in v6, so will be easy to update!
I see. if that release is stable, I'll remove them asap.
Oh, I misunderstood it, it is no need to input forever. OK I remove it,

Please don't remove it yet!  Or if you do, then you should copy these types into a v5 folder as described here: https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped#if-a-library-is-updated-to-a-new-major-version-with-breaking-changes-how-should-i-update-its-type-declaration-package

This is important for all the people still using version 5.x of the react-instantsearch library who want to get upgrades or contribute back to the type definitions.

BTW, this is a blocker for my team.  We intend to stay on v5 for a while.

And if it kept, I need some modification  because apiKey and appId exclusively independent on  algoliaClient. So It should be separated to UsingManualInfoProps. Please let me know if anyone has opinions about this.
My PR is based on algoliaClient deprecated.
@grurgett OK. I fixed it. This patch focus type mismatch so, backword compatibility type directory another PR when v6 stable released.
